cookie_policy: Cookies are small fragments of data stored on your device (computer, mobile phone, tablet or any other mobile device) as text files. They are used to store information between two page loads or between two visits to a website.
Quite simple, we do not use any cookie. Why? Because we prefer using better designed technologies like local storage and most importantly, we do not feel the need to track you.
Local storage is another way for websites to store data on your device. It regroups the following storage types:
Local storage, which is a semi-permanent storage space provided by your browser. Data stored in locale storage is kept unless the browsing history is deleted.
Session storage, which is also a storage space provided by your browser. Unlike local storage, data is kept only for the duration of the browsing session.
IndexedDB, which is a client-side, locally-stored database, useful for storing large amounts of data and accessing it quickly.
We use local storage to store user preferences, such as the website locale or the layers shown on maps, across different navigation sessions.
We use session storage to store the authentication token needed to keep authenticated users connected along their browsing session.
We use IndexedDB to cache some aircraft data, which drastically speeds up display of this data.

privacy_policy: As part of the operation of our site, we collect and process information some of which are described as «personal data». We undertake to comply with regulations concerning the protection of personal data, i.e. the law «Information technology and freedom» No. 78-17 of 6 January 1978, as well as European Regulation 2016/679 «General Data Protection Regulation» of 27 April 2016.
We collect personal data in two ways:
During a visit to our website, your web browser automatically sends us a certain number information, some of which are qualified as personal data.

When visiting our site, you can choose to perform a number of actions. Certain actions require you to provide us with information about you, some of which are qualified as personal data. This is the case if you create an account or send us a message through the contact form.

We do not collect or process any sensitive data. Sensitive data includes in the sense of the General Data Protection Regulation: Racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, union membership, or data related to health or sexual orientation.
We may collect the following categories of personal data:
Connection data: IP address of your Internet connection;
Identification data: Username, password and email address;
Contact data: Full name and email address;
Geolocation data: Geographical coordinates.
We strive to minimise the retention period of personal data. The maximum retention time of the data depends on the category to which it belongs, and are as follows:
The connection data is kept for a period of 15 days;
The identification data is kept for the entire lifetime of your account;
The contact data is kept for the period required to process your request;
The geolocation data is kept for the duration of the browsing session.

We limit the processing of your personal data to the strict requirements. The legal basis for the processing of the personal data we collect depends on the category to which they belong, and are as follows:

The processing of connection data is based on Articles 6.1.c of the General Data Protection Regulation: «Processing is necessary to comply with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject». We collect this data in order to comply with the legal obligation to ensure the security of personal data and to prevent the destruction, loss, alteration, or unauthorised disclosure of such data. The collection of this data is mandatory.

The processing of identification data is based on Article 6.1.a of the General Data Protection Regulation: «The data subject has consented to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes». We collect and process this data for the purpose of providing you with access to a user account. We collect your consent as a check box on the account creation form. Refusal of consent results in inability to use the functionality.

The processing of contact data is based on Article 6.1.a of the General Data Protection Regulation: «The data subject has consented to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes». We collect and process this data in order to provide you with a response when we receive a message via our contact form. We collect your consent in the form of a check box on the contact form. Refusal of consent results in inability to use the functionality.

The processing of geolocation data is based on Article 6.1.a of the General Data Protection Regulation: «The data subject has consented to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes». We collect and process this data in order to show your position on maps and to allow you to quickly center and zoom maps around your location. We collect your consent through the dialog box of your browser asking you to share your position. Refusal of consent results in inability to use the functionality.
The personal data collected are intended for the data controller, its service providers and any authority legally authorised to access the personal data in question.
The personal data we collect may be transferred outside the European Union to the technical infrastructure of our service providers.

We ensure that we only work with companies that protect your personal data and comply with applicable law in the same way we do. In accordance with Article 28 of the General Data Protection Regulation, access to your personal data by our service providers is subject to the signature of a written agreement that allows us to monitor and control the way they process your personal data.

{link}: All personal data collected may be transferred to the technical infrastructure of this service provider. We use this service provider to detect and facilitate the correction of software errors that you may encounter while using our site.
The personal data we collect is stored on the technical infrastructure of our service providers located within the European Union.
We implement all applicable technical and organisational measures to ensure the security of the personal data we collect.

In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation, you have a number of rights regarding your personal data and the use made of it. To exercise these rights, you may contact us specifying the nature of the right you wish to exercise and the reasons why you wish to exercise it:
Via the {link};
By email at the following address: {link}.
We may ask you for additional information, such as proof of identity, in order to guarantee the protection of personal data concerned by your request.

In accordance with Article 15 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to obtain confirmation that personal data concerning you are or are not processed and, when they are processed, access to such data and the following information:
The purposes of the processing;
The categories of personal data concerned;
The recipients to whom the personal data has been or will be communicated;
The retention period of this data;

The existence of the right to request from the data controller the rectification or erasure of personal data concerning you, the right to request a limitation of their processing, or the right to object to such processing;
The existence of the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
In accordance with Article 16 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to have your personal data corrected by the data controller as soon as possible.
You can exercise some of these rights on your own:
{link}

In accordance with Article 17 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to have your personal data deleted by the the controller as soon as possible. The controller has the obligation to delete this personal data as soon as possible when one of the following reasons applies:
Your personal data are no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected;
You withdraw the consent on which the processing of your personal data is based and there is no other legal basis for the processing;
You object to the processing of your personal data and there is no compelling legitimate reason for its retention;
Your personal data has been unlawfully processed;
Your personal data must be deleted to comply with a legal obligation.
You can exercise some of these rights on your own:
{link}
In accordance with Article 18 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to obtain from the data controller the limitation of processing when one of the following reasons applies:
You dispute the accuracy of your personal data. The processing shall then be suspended for a period allowing the data controller to verify the accuracy of your personal data;
The processing of your personal data is unlawful, you oppose their deletion and instead demand the limitation of their use;
The data controller no longer needs the personal data for the purposes of the processing, but these are still necessary for you to establish, exercise or defend legal rights;

You objected to the processing of your personal data. The processing shall then be suspended during the verification to determine whether the legitimate reasons pursued by the data controller prevail over yours.

In accordance with Article 20 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to obtain from the data controller a copy of the personal data concerning you provided to him, in a structured format, commonly used and machine readable. This right applies when:
Processing is based on your consent;
Processing is performed using automated processes.
You can exercise some of these rights on your own:
{link}
Please see the {link}.
